cardinfo.CI: Lonchocarpus - Senegal Lilac Tree/Senegal Lilac Tree - Canopy.jpg

V: The species are called lancepods due to their fruit resembling an ornate lance tip or a few beads on a string. A shrub, or small tree to 10 m high in Senegal (3) and up to 16 m in Ghana (10) and Nigeria (11), of dry deciduous, fringing and transition forests, often near water, and in Ghana and Sierra Leone (22) in coastal savanna; from Senegal to W Cameroons and F
